engine.overlay
Class OverlayManager

java.lang.Object
  engine.overlay.OverlayManager
Direct Known Subclasses:
OverlayPanel
public class OverlayManager
extends java.lang.Object

The OverlayManager class lets you create a group of Overlays, which can then be manipulated. You translate all the overlays, absolutely position them, or remove them all at once. This example creates an OverlayManager from the World class and bases it at point (0,0). Two Overlays are then added to the manager. OverlayManger manager = new OverlayManger(this,0,0); manager.addOverlay(someOverlay,10,10); manager.addOverlay(anotherOverlay,20,20);

Author:
Andrew Brown

Constructor Detail

OverlayManager

public OverlayManager(greenfoot.World world,
                      int x,
                      int y)
Constructs an OverlayManager that uses the given x and y coordinate as the offset for all its Overlays.

Parameters:
world - The world the OverlayManager will draw the Overlays in.
x - The x offset of all the Overlays (you can think of it as the x coordinate of the top-left corner of the OverlayManager).
y - The y offset of all the Overlays (you can think of it as the y coordinate of the top-left corner of the OverlayManager).
Method Detail

addOverlay

public void addOverlay(Overlay overlay,
                       int x,
                       int y)
Add the given Overlay to OverlayManager's group. The x and y coordinates are the offset from the x and y coordinates of the OverlayManager.

Parameters:
overlay - The overlay to add to the OverlayManager's group.
x - The x coordinate of the overlay relative to the x coordinate of the OverlayManager. Must be greater than 0.
y - The y coordinate of the overlay relative to the y coordinate of the OverlayManager. Must be greater than 0.

translateOverlays

public void translateOverlays(int x,
                              int y)
Translates all the Overlays in the OverlayManager by the x and y amounts given. If the given translation tries to move the Overlay out of the World the Overlay simply stops at the edge of the World.

Parameters:
x - The amount to translate the Overlays on the x axis.
y - The amount to translate the Overlays on the y axis.

setOverlayPosition

public void setOverlayPosition(int x,
                               int y)
Absolutely positions all the Overlays in the OverlayManager relative to the given x,y point.

Parameters:
x - The x coordinate at which to anchor the OverlayManager. Must be within the boundaries of the World.
y - The y coordinate at which to anchor the OverlayManager. Must be within the boundaries of the World.

removeOverlays

public void removeOverlays()
Removes all the Overlays in the OverlayManager from the World.

getOverlays

public java.util.Collection<Overlay> getOverlays()
Returns all the Overlays in the OverlayManager.

Returns:
Returns the Set of Overlays in the OverlayManager.

getWorld

public greenfoot.World getWorld()
Returns the World the OverlayManager draws the Overlays in.

Returns:
The World that the OverlayManager draws the Overlays in.
